question.body: What are the issues which affect the decision between setting up a wired network or a wireless network?

answer.body: Cost, Ease of Deployment, Scalability, and Flexibility.

question.body: What are some advantages of wireless networks?

answer.body: Mobility, Ease of deployment, Reduced Cost-of-Ownership, Scalability, and Flexibility.

question.body: What are some disadvantages of wireless networks?

answer.body: Setup and Configuration, Stability, Security, and Speed.

question.body: List and discuss 3 aspects/areas of personal mobile communication impacted by mobility.

answer.body: Mobile Devices: Lighter, more robust, constrained by battery; Network Protocols: Change in name, address, location, etc.; Security: Endpoint authentication is harder; Performance: Network is slower and delay and jitter are increased; Operation: Need software resources to track and manage devices; Applications: Need to deal with changes in connectivity and QoS;

question.body: What is the Hidden Node Problem and how is it solved?

answer.body: When two nodes that are invisible to each other communicate with a third node, their transmissions interfere, as they can not sense the carrier. Handshaking using RTS/CTS (Request to Send/Clear to Send) is implemented in conjunction with the CSMA/CA to overcome this problem.

question.body: What is the Exposed Node Problem and how is it solved?

answer.body: When a node is transmitting to another node and a third node wants to transmit to a fourth one, the third node may falsely believe that it can not do so because it would cause interference. In reality the second node might be outside of transmission range of node three and the fourth node out of transmission range of node one. RTS/CTS messages may be used to overcome this problem under certain circumstances.

question.body: List 3 impairments to wireless signal propagation and explain how each impairment can be alleviated.

answer.body: Attenuation and Attenuation Distortion: Adaptive equalizer; Free Space Loss: Boost signal strength; Multipath Propagation: Forward error correction;

question.body: List 3 common sources of noise in wireless communication systems and explain their causes.

answer.body: Thermal noise: Function of temperature; Intermodulation noise: Occurs if signals with different frequencies share the same medium; Crosstalk: One circuit accidentally picks up signals in another

question.body: What are the 2 common algorithms used in an adaptive filter to derive the optimum weights of the filter? State the cost functions used by the 2 algorithms to minimize the error signal.

answer.body: Least Mean Squares (LMS) and Recursive Least Square (RLS).

question.body: What are the 3 common important signal propagation mechanisms that result in multipath propagation of wireless signals?
What are the characteristics of a Rayleigh fading channel?

answer.body: Large number of multipath signals with no dominant signal along line-of-sight.

question.body: What are the characteristics of a Rician fading channel?

answer.body: Large number of multipath signals with a dominant signal.

question.body: What are the 2 basic properties that determine the quality of digitized speech signal?
List and briefly explain the 3 basic types of digital modulation.
What are the 2 transmission techniques used?

answer.body: Narrow‐band transmission: Each signal transmits on one radio frequency, or a very narrow range of frequencies; Spread spectrum transmission: Transmitter takes a narrow band signal and spreads it over a broader portion of the radio frequency band

question.body: What are the 2 common spread spectrum techniques used? Briefly explain their operations.

answer.body: Frequency Hopping Spread Spectrum (FHSS): Use a range of frequencies and change frequency multiple times during transmission; Direct Sequence Spread Spectrum (DSSS): Uses an expanded redundant code to encode each data bit before transmitting

question.body: What are the 3 most common techniques adopted to support multiple access in wireless communication?

answer.body: Frequency Division Multiple Access (FDMA), Time Division Multiple Access (TDMA), and Code Division Multiple Access (CDMA)

question.body: FDMA is susceptible to crosstalk. Suggest a common mechanism to reduce crosstalk. What is the disadvantage of using this mechanism.

answer.body: Special guard band frequencies are used to prevent the frequencies from “bleeding” over one another. This reduces usable bandwidth.
